description: From game +‎ -ly; compare Old English gamenlīċ (“belonging to games, sportive, theatrical, ridiculous”) and Middle High German gāmelich, gemelich (“joyful”).

adjectives.description: gamely (comparative gamelier or more gamely, superlative gameliest or most gamely)

examples: This confirmed the penetration of the theoretical knowledge of color when it is taught using a gamely practice where the act of working come to be a pleasure.

entries.meaning: (hunting, fishing, etc.) Of or pertaining to game.

adverbs.description: gamely (comparative more gamely, superlative most gamely)

entries.meaning: In a game or plucky manner; in a willing and spirited fashion.
